head.supplied: Melbourne Botanic Garden, ¶ 27 November 1867. ¶ ¶ I do not know, esteemed Professor, if a publication about McIntyre's expedition, showing about 5 degrees of further travels and quite a few new geogr...

div.p: Sammlung Perthes Archiv, SPA ARCH PGM 328 , Forschungsbibliothek Gotha der Universität Erfurt.
MS annotation: by Petermann: 'Erh. 20. Jan. 1868' [Received 20 January 1868]. For a published version of this letter, see Voigt (1996), p. 86. Melb. im bot. Garten

Ich weiss nicht, verehrter Herr Professor, ob ein Druck über M'Intyre´s Reise mit etwa 5 Graden neuen Zuges u manchen neuen geographischen Localitäten bei Ihnen eintraf. Wenn nicht, muss ich diese wichtige Nachricht erneuen. Von Zeit zu Zeit haben Sie mir freundlichst Ihre werthen Mittheilungen zugesandt, für welche ich dankbar verpflichtet bin. Im Jahr 1868 werden wieder neue Forschungsparthien in Australien im Felde sein.

Der Neffe Ihres edlen Fürsten ist seit einigen Tagen hier u Sr. Königl Hoheit ist eine wahrhaft triumphhafte Ovation gebracht. Gestern war Levée, der ich beitrat. Heute Ball beim Gouverneur u da will ich versuchen, ob auf des Prinzen Reise nichts für die Erforschung der Osterinseln geschehen kann. Morgen wird ein grossartiges Volksfest auf meinem Parkgrund dem Prinzen zu Ehren Statt finden. Alles dies erheischt meine Aufmerksamkeit. So scheide ich denn mit einem hastigen aber herzlichen Gruss.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
I do not know, esteemed Professor, if a publication about McIntyre's expedition, showing about 5 degrees of further travels and quite a few new geographical localities has reached you.
Ladies' Leichhardt Search Expedition, 1865-6. M is no doubt referring to the version of Duncan McIntyre's journal that was published in the Age, 23 November 1866, p. 5 and subsequent issues, copies of which he had sent to Petermann (see M to A. Petermann, 5 February 1868 (in this edition as 68-02-05a). If not, I shall have to repeat this important news. You have been so kind as to send me your valued Mittheilungen
Mittheilungen aus Justus Perthes' geographischer Anstalt, edited by Petermann. from time to time, and I am gratefully obliged to you for these. New exploration parties will once again be in the field in Australia in 1868.

The nephew of your noble Sovereign
Alfred, Duke of Edinburgh and of Saxe-Coburg-Gotha, nephew of Duke Ernst II. has been here for a few days, and a truly triumphal ovation was offered to His Royal Highness. Yesterday there was a levee that I attended. Today is the Governor's ball and I shall see there whether something cannot be done about the exploration of Easter Island during the Prince's voyage. Tomorrow a magnificent people's festival in honour of the Prince will take place in my grounds.
The 'festival', advertised as a citizens' banquet open to all, turned into a complete shambles; see Poynter (2014), pp. 3-38. All this requires my attention. So I say farewell with a hasty but sincere greeting.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
font-family: Geneva; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in; font-size: 10pt;
